basics: Kripke frames form (0,1)-categories with worlds as objects and accessibility as morphisms
Different modal logics correspond to different categorical properties (K=general, T=identities, S4=preorder, S5=groupoid)
Mathlib4 provides comprehensive category theory infrastructure via CategoryTheory.* modules
TaskFrame has inherent categorical structure via compositionality axiom
functors: P-morphisms (bounded morphisms) are precisely functors between frame categories
Functors preserve modal truth: M₁,w ⊨ φ ⟺ M₂,f(w) ⊨ φ
TaskFrame functors enable task abstraction and refinement
Bisimulations are functors in both directions
natural_transformations: Natural transformations relate different model interpretations
Model refinements formalized as natural transformations
adjunctions: Modal operators form adjunction: ◊ ⊣ □ (diamond left adjoint to box)
Adjunction explains distribution laws: □ over ∧, ◊ over ∨
Stone duality: adjunction between modal algebras (syntax) and modal spaces (semantics)
Galois connections mirror interior/closure and □/◊ duality

implementation_recommendations: Define category instances for S4/S5 frames and TaskFrame
